title: Any Naval Criminal Investigative Service  investigations from 1987 to 1991 regarding James Renwick Manship, LCDR, SSN4#-6577,

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any Naval Criminal Investigative Service  investigations from 1987 to 1991 regarding James Renwick Manship, LCDR, SSN4#-6577,
relating to commands (1) Commander Naval Security Group Command, (2) Commander Naval Reserve Readiness Region Seven, (3) Commander Naval Reserve Readiness Region Six, (4) Commander Naval Reserve Readiness Region EIght, (5) Deparment of Defense Inspector General, or (6) then Congressman Barbara Boxer, Member of the House Armed Services Committee.
Naval Criminal Investigative Service 
Attn: Code 00LJF27130 
Telegraph Road
Quantico, VA 22134-2253
Or Fax - (571) 305-9867

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Renwick Manship

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: SLMPD RTCC Data
The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO DPS Private Contractors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list of private-sector security or investigation firms, companies, organizations, corporations, collaboratives or other entities contracting with Missouri Department of Public Safety to provide reporting of surveillance, security, intelligence or investigation for the purpose of public safety. 

I request that in conducting searches for releasable records, that you please disclose records even if they are currently available publicly through (your agency portal) other sources outside of your agency, such as the Missouri Accountability Portal or the National Archives and Records Administration

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use. 

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.  

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or USB thumb drive if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

title: Navy Medical Records for James Renwick Manship

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Navy Medical Records for James Renwick Manship, last four SSN 6577, DOB 19530508.  Began service as Midshipman in  September 1970. Discharged as LCDR on 30 April 1988.  Especially concerned with Medical Records from August 1978 to February 1979, and from June 1985 to May 1988.  Seek information in relation to Service Connected Injuries for Veteran Disability Income applications, supplementals, and appeals process paperwork.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Renwick Manship
